intro: Schizoloma pentaphyllum, commonly known as the five-lobed lichen, is a member of the Lecanoromycetes class and is characterized by its unique thallus structure. It typically grows on bark or stone in temperate forest environments, forming a crustose or foliose growth form. The plant's morphology includes a complex arrangement of lobes and pores, which contribute to its distinctive appearance. It is primarily found in regions with high humidity and moderate temperatures, such as parts of Europe and North America. Due to its slow growth and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
